page.title: 11BRACE AND PISTOLS PUB
page.content: The owner of the Brace and Pistols was interviewed at his pub in St. Johns Street.He has only been there for four months.Some time ago the building was a dairy but it was converted to a pub about 30 years ago. The busiest days of the week are Saturday and Sunday when a lot of people are home from work. The most popular drink is beer. Some people come into the pub when they are on holiday at Clacton which is not very far away. Summer is always busier than Winter.The owners previously ran a pub at Brightlingsea about 13 kilometres away.They like this area on the edge of Clacton because it is peaceful.The customers are friendly.
